page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF CONGRESBURY YEO
page.content: The whole area of the parishes of Wick St. Lawrence and Kingston Seymour is flat and low-lying. The level of the land varies from 30 feet above to 30 feet below sea level. The fields are small and bounded by mixed hedges. The trees and bushes which make up these hedges are hawthorn, blackthorn,elderberry,willow and blackberry. Most of the elm trees disappeared in an epidemic of Dutch Elm Disease during the 1970's, which greatly altered the skyline and meant the loss of many trees. The roadsides and fields are bounded by drainage ditches known as rhines, which remove the surface water. The farmhouses, mostly built in the 18th and 19th centuries are strung out along the roads surrounded by their own land. A few houses cluster round the church to form the village centres
